instructions:
Melt margarine in a 2 quart pot and sauté the chopped onions and peppers for 5 minutes. Add the
mushroom soup and milk and heat to a simmer while stirring to a smooth sauce. Add mushrooms and broken
tuna *(and peas)* while reheating to a simmer. Cook noodles to desired tenderness. Combine noodles and
sauce and pour into a 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with crushed potato chips and add 1/2 tbsp margarine
bits. Bake in a 375 F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until bubbly.

VARIATION:
For Creamed Tuna on Toast, use all but last 3 ingredients and serve on toast.
ingredients: 1/4 cup frozen chopped bell pepper (green and/or red)
1 can (10 oz) Campbell's cream of mushroom soup
1 can (6 oz) tuna, broken in chunks
name: Tuna Noodle Casserole
creator: Mary Decker
